meanings.definition: In a self-important or pompous manner
meanings.sent1: He walked bumptiously into the room, thinking he was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: She spoke bumptiously, bragging about her accomplishments.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted bumptiously around the house, as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone bumptiously, casting a golden glow over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The teacher bumptiously corrected the students, believing she knew everything.

meanings.sent1: His bumptiously arrogant attitude rubbed people the wrong way.
meanings.sent2: The bumptiously proud peacock displayed its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent3: The bumptiously confident squirrel thought it could outsmart everyone.
meanings.sent4: The bumptiously haughty queen looked down on her subjects from her throne.
meanings.sent5: The bumptiously boastful athlete celebrated his victory with a loud cheer.

meanings.definition: Acting in a boastful or conceited way
meanings.sent1: Her bumptiously conceited behavior alienated her friends.
meanings.sent2: The bumptiously bragging child annoyed the other kids at the playground.
meanings.sent3: The bumptiously show-offy magician amazed the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The bumptiously self-centered actor only cared about his own performance.
meanings.sent5: The bumptiously pretentious artist thought his work was above criticism.
